Keywords: Codex , Monster , Past , S.H.I.E.L.D. , Scientist , Spider-Man Family
Real Name: Eddie Brock
Special Powers
MY KIND OF ALLIES: When establishing themed teams, characters on your starting force with the Scientist keyword gain the Spider-Man Family keyword.
CALL IN HELP FROM THE VENOMVERSE: When Leonardo Da Venom hits an opposing character, if no character has been placed this turn, after resolutions you may roll a d6. 3-6: Place another friendly character whose name includes "Venom" adjacent.
THE VENOVIAN MAN: Flurry, Plasticity, Shape Change. // When Leonardo Da Venom makes an attack roll of doubles and hits, choose one: the attack is a critical hit -or- after resolutions, unequip all equipment equipped to a hit target.
THE SMARTEST MAN OF THE AGE: Outwit, Perplex. // When an opposing character uses Outwit or Perplex, their maximum range is 4.

November 25, 2020
killerjello
@destructoboy, sorry I realized I wasn't being clear. My point was, looking at all the figures with Venom in their name, there's very few that can make use of the traits Leonardo and the other chases have. I used the term bring in and I should have said call in. Leonardo can call in help from the Venomverse, but if you want a Venom figure who can also be given the Spider-Man Family keyword from any of the spider chases, I could only find Venom Black Panther. Because he has the Ruler keyword, you can run Spider Pharoah and give him Spider-Man Family keyword. My contention is that Calling in Help from the Venomverse, is at odds with giving scientist keyword figures the Spider-Man Family keyword. Thus making it hard to get the full use of both traits. Maybe if Leonardo gave figures both Brute and Scientist keywords the Spider-Man Family keyword, he could be used with more figures. Wistful thinking I guess, he's my favorite looking chase, I just wish he was not so disjointed.
November 23, 2020
tidge
Most of the 'Venomverse summoning' traits ONLY work with other friendly characters on the map. There are exceptional variations to the 'summon' power (Dr. Strange, Groot, FF Agent Venom) but otherwise those figures which have it all work the same: No friendly figure (on the map) with can have been placed that turn, and it must include "Venom" in the name. In my experience, the trait works very well to reposition friendly figures to dogpile opposing figures. For example, the What If? 048e Chase Hulk doesn't have any improved movement or move+attack. In the case of Leonardo Da Venom, this may actually be a better choice to BE summoned: as a flier, he can extract a fellow Venom that may be over-extended.

Flash Thompson Venoms have soldier, but he already has the Spider-Man Family keyword. With all this in mind, has anyone had fun playing him and what kind of team did you use?
